page.title: 14A Farm In The Wyndham
page.content: Fronwen Farm is a hill farm of about 70 acres situated on the mountainside above Wyndham and owned and run by Mr. Thomas and his son Roger who live in the farm-house. There is a stable and cowshed joined to the house, a large sheep shed, a dutch barn, an open shed, pig-sty's a tractor shed and a mountain shed. It is mainly a sheep farm and there are about 500 Welsh Mountain Sheep. Dipping and breeding starts in October. Most of the lambs are born in the sheep shed. At the end of maythe lambs are ear marked and marked. Shearing is in June. In August many lambs are taken to Blackmill sales. There is also an ewe at Blackmill in September and a ram sale in October. Foxes have killed a number of lambs this year. There are 40 Welsh Black or Hereford Friesian cross store cattle.There are 4 dogs and 2 horses.
